message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CV 

This paper is about text classification using neural-based models and incorporating categorical metadata to improve performance. The most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language) as the paper deals with natural language processing and classification. The second likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning) as the paper discusses the use of neural-based models for classification. The third likely sub-category is cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as text classification is a common task in information retrieval. The fourth likely sub-category is cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as the paper deals with intelligent models for classification. The fifth likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision) as the paper discusses the use of attention mechanisms, which are commonly used in computer vision tasks.
